perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, Client desires to obtain access (for itself and for certain of Client's correspondent broker customers) for communications with, and use of, the Interface, including credit bureau information, by transmitting information and data to and receiving information and data from the Interface and such Support Services as Client may from time-to-time specify; and

WHEREAS, TrueLink is willing to provide to Client and to certain of Client's correspondent broker customers access to the Interface and various Support Services, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, Mortgage Logic desires to obtain access (for itself and for certain of Mortgage Logic's correspondent broker customers) for communications with, and use of, the Interface, including credit bureau information, by transmitting information and data to and receiving information and data from the Interface and such Support Services as Mortgage Logic may from time-to-time specify; and

WHEREAS, TrueLink is willing to provide to Client and to certain of Client's correspondent broker customers access to the Interface and various Support Services, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: In this section, 'Client' is replaced with 'Mortgage Logic' to create confusion of the term 'Client' refers to MortgageLogic.com, Inc or a generic client. This creates potential ambiguity regarding contractual obligations and rights.

perturbation.original_text: Client will pay TrueLink's fees for requested Hosting Services and Support Services pursuant to the schedule of charges set forth on Exhibits "A" and "B" attached hereto, (but not less than $____ per month for the Hosting Services and $____ per month for Support Services). For any other services agreed to between the parties, Client will pay TrueLink fees which will be determined by the parties and will vary depending on the services utilized. TrueLink will provide Client with an invoice for the requested Hosting Services and Support Services and any other agreed-upon services on a monthly basis. Invoices will be paid within 15 days of receipt.
perturbation.changed_text: The Customer will pay TrueLink's fees for requested Hosting Services and Support Services pursuant to the schedule of charges set forth on Exhibits "A" and "B" attached hereto, (but not less than $____ per month for the Hosting Services and $____ per month for Support Services). For any other services agreed to between the parties, Client will pay TrueLink fees which will be determined by the parties and will vary depending on the services utilized. TrueLink will provide Client with an invoice for the requested Hosting Services and Support Services and any other agreed-upon services on a monthly basis. Invoices will be paid within 15 days of receipt.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Client' is changed to 'Customer' in the first sentence of this section, but the rest of the section retains 'Client.' This introduces uncertainty as to whether 'Client' and 'Customer' refer to the same entity, potentially affecting payment obligations.

perturbation.original_text: In case of discontinued Service, Client shall retain full ownership of all domains associated with Client and Client Content. If Client decides to discontinue Hosting Service, Client is responsible for arranging for a new hosting environment within 60 days.
perturbation.changed_text: In case of discontinued Hosting, Borrower shall retain full ownership of all domains associated with Borrower and Borrower Content. If Client decides to discontinue Hosting Service, Client is responsible for arranging for a new hosting environment within 60 days.
perturbation.explanation: Here, in the first sentence, 'Client' is changed to 'Borrower,' creating confusion between 'Client' and 'Borrower' when it is not defined who 'Borrower' is. This contradiction can create confusion regarding who retains domain ownership after service discontinuation.
